subject: Law
title: The Reconstruction Amendments
description: A 60-second lesson on The Reconstruction Amendments.

hook.text: After the Civil War, three amendments promised freedom and equality. It took a century for the promise to stick.

buildup.text: The 13th abolished slavery, the 14th granted citizenship and equal protection, and the 15th protected voting rights.

discovery.text: Congress could enforce these amendments through legislation‚Äîgiving the federal government new power over states.

twist.text: Southern states undermined them with Jim Crow laws, poll taxes, and violence. The Supreme Court often looked away.

climax.text: The civil rights movement of the 1950s-60s finally forced the nation to honor these amendments' promises.

punchline.text: Writing rights into law was step one. Making them real took a century more.

quiz.question: Which amendment granted citizenship and equal protection?
